meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: I always prehandle my homework assignments to avoid last-minute stress.
meanings.sent2: She likes to prehandle her daily tasks to stay organized.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel prehandles its food before storing it for the winter.
meanings.sent4: He prehandles his emotions before confronting a difficult situation.
meanings.sent5: Prehandling your responsibilities can lead to a smoother workflow.

meanings.definition: To prepare or get ready to handle something.
meanings.sent1: Before the trip, they prehandle all the necessary supplies.
meanings.sent2: The team prehandles their equipment before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The chef prehandles the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent4: She prehandles her presentation slides to ensure a successful meeting.
meanings.sent5: Prehandling the project details is crucial for a successful outcome.
